title: Aniello 2014 Vino de Parcela Única Trousseau (Patagonia)
description: This might be the only commercial Trousseau from Argentina, and it's rusty in color, with translucence. Savory challenging aromas of orange peel and burnt orange include notes of dried cherry and fallen leaves. A tightly knit palate is home to flavors of dried cherry and plum as well as tomato sauce. A hint of maple vies with dried red-fruit flavors on a light finish that shows some elegance.

title: Ardales 2011 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Ripe raisiny aromas are soft, maybe to a fault. This feels wide, grabby and modest in structure. Jammy raspberry and raisin flavors finish plump and easy, with low acidity. Drink now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Asuncion Ridge 2013 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Extracted aromas of dried black cherries, vanilla and clove show on the nose of this bottling from west of Paso Robles. The palate packs lots of action, from root beer and cola to dark mulberry, green peppercorn, black pepper and a lingering anise finish.

title: Barão de Vilar 2014 Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: Big and bold, this is a structured, dark wine. Its wood aging still shows, although this will integrate. It will be a powerful, rich wine, dense and with dark tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Barnard Griffin 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of yellow apple, pear and spice are light but enchanting. The tart flavors bring a lightly creamy feel, showing a sense of poise.

title: Barone Cornacchia 2011 Vizzarro  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)
description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals aromas of dried black fruit, sunbaked earth, pressed flower and a touch of menthol. The solid medium-bodied palate offers black cherry, coffee and clove framed in close-grained tannins. Drink soon.

title: Benton-Lane 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This smooth and toasty effort offers aromatic hints of cracker, coconut and raw cashews. The rhubarb and strawberry fruit flavors are in the background, streaked with cola and root beer. A touch of chocolate carries through the finish.

title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Château Tour Blanche  (Médoc)
description: This is an attractive, crisp and fruity wine. It has layers of wood that are already integrating well with the black-currant fruitiness. Tannins and a firm core are signs that the wine will age well. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.

title: Boatique 2014 Petite Sirah (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Relatively light for the variety, this wine has lots of tasty, almost jammy fruit flavors, medium tannins and a smooth but gripping texture. It's very good to drink now.

title: Firestone 2013 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark blueberry, black plum and blackberry fruits meet with dried violet, lavender and cracked pavement on the nose of this bottling. The palate picks up a soy-meets-blueberry-chiffon element, with splashes of rosewater and cola.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a round, plush and likable wine, accented in earthy forest and hints of rose petal that offer spicy acidity and a leathery texture. The relationship to cola spice and black cherry is solid and clear.

title: Maison Givas 2014 Vin No. 09  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: Full of jammy Merlot fruits, this is a smooth ripe wine. Dried fruits and tannins give the wine its varietal character. They are freshened by the acidity and black-currant fruitiness. The aftertaste allows the firm tannins to shine. Drink from 2017.

title: Maison Givas 2014 Vin No 1  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)
description: The wine is seriously structured for the vintage: that means a wine that is full of tannins, dark and firm. It has concentration and black fruits, shot through with acidity. Drink this dense wine from 2018.

title: Malvirà 2014 Vigna Renesio  (Roero)
description: Orchard blossom, green apple and chopped aromatic herb aromas give way to a fresh concentrated palate. A hazelnut note adds interest and signals the close.

title: Miro 2014 Coyote Ridge Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Inky black, this bold 100% varietal wine is also pretty, its fruit high-toned and marked by knots of mint and dried herb. Medium bodied, it doesn't go down an overripe road, remaining satisfying as a wine that could work with food.

title: Jason-Stephens 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Dark and spicy blackcurrant fruit, black-cherry skins and a touch of richer chocolate show on the nose of this bottling. Light in body, the palate shows blackberry, black pepper, oregano and pencil lead, with a minerally undercurrent.

title: Maritávora 2014 Maritávora 6 Classic Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe and fruity, layered with attractive tannins and red-berry fruits. It is bright, crisp at the edges although also with a smoky, firm core. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: This is a sharp, almost liquorous wine. It features plump fruit flavors of yellow apple, pear and white peach. Barrel fermented in French oak, it still needs a bit more bottle age to round itself out. Drink 2018 and beyond.

title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: Here is a spicy racy palate-ripping Chardonnay. The fruit rules here, a tasty mix of lime, pineapple, grapefruit and green apples. It was barrel fermented in French oak, though its flavors are more along the lines of a stainless steel style.

title: Pacific Rim 2015 Hahn Hill Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: Coming from the state's oldest Chenin plantings, this wine brings light aromas and plenty of broad-feeling fruit flavors, resulting in a dry-drinking offering. Pair it with food to see it at its best.

title: Pacific Rim 2015 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Somewhat subdued aromas of jasmine, herb and orange peel are followed by plentiful medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors. The finish lingers. It delivers a lot of enjoyment.

title: Reininger 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This 100% varietal wine is a blend of fruit from Pepper Bridge and XL vineyards. It offers intriguing aromas of sandalwood, rose petal, wood spice and black currant, with the oak a bit out front. The dark-fruit flavors are reserved in style, tapering toward the finish.

title: People's Wine Revolution 2013 Bea's Knees Oberti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Grapy aromas and bold black pepper and blackberry flavors make this wine big and enjoyable. Full bodied, it has a mouthcoating texture and lingering finish.

title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Superior Tinto Red (Douro)
description: Red fruits dominate this wine that is ready to drink. It has berry flavors, generous tannins and sweetness at the end. Drink this attractive wine from late 2017.

title: Quinta do Filoco 2014 Filoco Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This wine is rich, full of fruit and with a medium-term potential. Attractive berry flavors are ripe and full of juicy acidity. Drink this lively, fruity wine from 2018.

title: Poças 2015 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)
description: With both Malvasia and Moscatel in the blend, this is an attractively perfumed wine. Ripe and full bodied, it's a smooth wine lifted by the floral character, making it delicious as an apéritif style. Drink now.

title: Portalupi 2014 Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)
description: Floral in a wealth of violet, this balanced red has tight-grained tannin supporting fully developed flavors of blueberry and black cherry finished in oaky leather. A restrained version of the variety, it lets the fruit speak without becoming overly ripe on the palate.

title: Viña Cobos 2014 Felino Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Cedary oak, tobacco, wood spice and black-fruit aromas are on the heavy side. The palate follows that lead with a chunky bumpy feel. Pushy black-fruit flavors come with chocolate and herbal notes, while this tastes of chocolate mint and feels scratchy and tannic on the finish.

title: Sextant 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)
description: An action-packed wine, especially considering the price, this is a lighter, fresher style of Zin, with smashed strawberry and boysenberry fruit aromas alongside chipped asphalt and riverstone. Juicy olallieberry and baked cherry show on the sip that is enhanced by a touch of oregano.

title: Syncline 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Washington)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from the Columbia Gorge and Terrace Heights. White pepper, green vegetable and flower blossom aromas lead to light, dry, puckering fruit flavors. Put it on the dinner table to see it shine.
